name: Web Comic/Reading Tracking Application
description: Currently developing a mobile/web application to track web comic reading progress on third-party websites. Built with React Native and Django for the frontend and backend. Plans to implement a repository of varied manga/web comics which would allow users to search and select natively. Have begun progress on developing a browser extension to automatically detect and save your reading progress.

name: Mob Control Style Android Application
description: Utilizing Unity and C# to create a Mob Control-style game. Conducted extensive market research to understand the niche and plan for future monetary schemes. Plans to implement dynamic ad display strategies to maximize revenue.

name: Electronic Circuit Simulation Software
description: Worked with a team of five other engineers to develop software to virtually build and test circuits. Leveraged PyQt5 to create a reactive graphical interface that stored data into a MySQL database via SQLAlchemy's reflection API. Deployed and managed relevant MySQL database in a Docker container. Implemented a CI/CD pipeline using Docker-in-Docker runners on GitLab for automated testing and deployment.

name: Multi Threaded “Mini-Spark” C Program
description: Applied multithreading principles to create a functional Apache Spark style program. Leveraged semaphores, lifecycle functions, and POSIX thread functions to prevent deadlocks and maximize parallelism.

name: Cat Adoption Web Application
description: Developed using React libraries to create a multi-page and Bootstrap application for cat adoption; programmed state variables, useEffect, routing, and other concepts to make the website fully responsive.

name: New Jersey Institute of Technology Brain Connectivity Lab
description: Leveraged Python, Perl, and MATLAB for large dataset analysis to investigate group-level differences in functional connectivity between fMRI scans of different populations; researched, wrote, and submitted an undergraduate research innovation grant for a study to predict sleep stages using Hidden Markov Models (HMMs).Leveraged Python, Perl, and MATLAB for large dataset analysis to investigate group-level differences in functional connectivity between fMRI scans of different populations; researched, wrote, and submitted an undergraduate research innovation grant for a study to predict sleep stages using Hidden Markov Models (HMMs).
